bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to William F. Wharton, August 24, 1889
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consular General

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, August 24th, 1889
Mr. Ezekiel E. Smith To the Deartment of State.
Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, August 24th, 1889
Honorable William F. Wharton Acting Secretary of State, Wasington, D. C.
Sir: I have the honor respectfully to acknowledge the receipt of your No. 30 Dip. Series of July 10th 1889l also, your circulars of July 10th, 18th and 15th respectfully.
Reports as required will be prepared and transmitted at the earliest day possible.
I have the honor to be, sir, your obedient servant,
Ezekiel E. Smith U.S. Consul General.
